## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
dir C:\tmp\test1.txt -Filter "*.json"

    Directory: C:\tmp

Mode                 LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                 -------------         ------ ----
-a---          28.04.2020    21:26             14 test1.txt
```

## Expected behavior

```none
only *.json files are returned
```

## Actual behavior

```none
test1.txt is returned
```

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.2.0-preview.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.2.0-preview.2-47-gef187d94f3b503d68a3cab818c255f1adb69c8fa
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18363
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: jdhitsolutions
comments.body: This looks normal to me, although `Get-ChildItem` has always been a bit odd. You are using C:\tmp\test1.txt as the Path. There are no child items as the "path" is simply the file. So `-Filter` has nothing to do.  `Get-Childitem C:\tmp -filter *.json` should work.

title: Get-ChildItem with Filter does not filter
